title: 115_hr2555
content: The "Veterans' Health Care Integrity Act of 2017" requires compliance of medical facilities with scheduling appointments for hospital care and medical services. The "Veterans' Health Care Integrity Act of 2017" mandates annual certification by each VA medical facility director to ensure compliance with scheduling regulations and accurate reporting of wait times for appointments. The Secretary cannot waive any related regulations for a facility. The director of a VA medical facility must annually certify compliance with scheduling regulations and accurate reporting of wait times. If certification is not made, a report must be submitted explaining the noncompliance and actions being taken. Noncompliance results in a prohibition on bonuses for covered officials. The Secretary must submit an annual report to Congress listing VA medical facilities where certification was and was not made regarding scheduling regulations and wait time reporting. Noncompliance results in bonus prohibition for certain officials. The Secretary must submit an annual report to Congress listing VA medical facilities where certification was and was not made regarding scheduling regulations and wait time reporting, including a copy of each report submitted to the Secretary under subsection (b). The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must apply department directives uniformly to all offices and facilities. If there is a deviation, the Secretary must notify the Committees on Veterans' Affairs. Additionally, certain officials of the Department of Veterans Affairs require appointment and confirmation. The appointment process for key officials in the Department of Veterans Affairs is outlined, with the Principal Deputy Under Secretary for Health requiring appointment by the Secretary, and other Deputy Under Secretary positions appointed by the President with Senate approval. Recommendations from the Under Secretary for Health are necessary for certain appointments. The President appoints key officials for Field Operations in the Department of Veterans Affairs with Senate approval. No new positions can be created within the Department. These rules apply to appointments made after the enactment of this Act.
